result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy D. Bicknase was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs + DNA surcharge.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
No contact with Melanie Liebe or her residence or place of employment.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
 Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy D. Bicknase

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

10:07 a.m. Defendant Troy D. Bicknase in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Prosecutor states plea agreement. W/H Sentence offer.
Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions the Defendant as to his waiver of right to an attorney.
Court finds Defendant's Plea and waiver of right to an attorney is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
ADA Constable states the facts of the case.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:**********PROBATION

W/H Sentence: 12 mo Probation, concurrent to any other probation sentence
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
No contact with Melanie Liebe or her residence or place of employment.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
 Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
3 days jail credit

1:54   Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
Bond continued.
Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:15 am.

$1,000 sig bond:   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. No contact with  Melanie Liebe or the Comfort Inn in Plover.

To be heard today at 1:15 p.m.
